greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least STC-number of a composition whose sequence of run-lengths has STC-number n.
comment: A composition of n is a finite sequence of positive integers summing to n. The composition with STC-number k (row k of A066099) is obtained by taking the set of positions of 1's in the reversed binary expansion of k, prepending 0, taking first differences, and reversing again. This gives a bijective correspondence between nonnegative integers and integer compositions.
example: The sequence together with the corresponding compositions begins:
xref: Position of first appearance of n in A333627.
All of the following pertain to compositions in standard order (A066099):
- Compositions without ones are ranked by A022340.
- The partial sums from the right are A048793.
- Adjacent equal pairs are counted by A124762.
- Equal runs are counted by A124767.
- Strict compositions are ranked by A233564.
- The partial sums from the left are A272020.
- Constant compositions are ranked by A272919.
- Normal compositions are ranked by A333217.
- Adjacent unequal pairs are counted by A333382.
- First appearances of run-resistances are A333629.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Mar 31 2020
